options.label: HubDB - get details of a published table

children.label: Object type
children.tooltipText: Valid object type for the CRM (contacts, companies, deals, tickets, etc.).
children.subtitle: Valid object type for the CRM.

children.label: Object ID
children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the object was created. If you do not remember it, you can use list objects to find the id.
children.subtitle: Identifier of the object.

children.tooltipText: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to false.
children.subtitle: Whether to return only archived results.
children.label: Archived
Include foreign IDs
children.subtitle: If true, populate foreign ID values in the result.
children.tooltipText: Set this to true  to populate foreign ID values in the result. Defaults to false.

children.label: Table ID or name
children.subtitle: Table name or ID of the table to update.
children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the table was created. If you do not remember it, you can use get published table to find the table ID or the name.

children.label: Name
children.subtitle: Name of the resulting table.
children.tooltipText: Name that will be used to identify the table.

children.label: Label
children.subtitle: Label of the resulting table.
children.tooltipText: Label to represent the table name.

children.label: Use for pages
children.subtitle: If true, the table can be used for creation of dynamic pages.
children.tooltipText: The table can be used for creation of dynamic pages. Default value: false

children.label: Columns
children.subtitle: List of columns in the table.
children.tooltipText: List of columns in the table. Refer Hubspot documentation to create the columns, all column fields are required (id, name, label, type, options). in options you can add multi-columns. type: array

children.label: Allow public API access
children.subtitle: If true, the table can be read by public without authorization.
children.tooltipText: The table can be read by public without authorization. Default value: false

children.label: Allow child tables
children.subtitle: If true, the child tables can be created.
children.tooltipText: Whether child tables can be created. Default value:false

children.label: Enable child table pages
children.subtitle: If true, is created a multi-level dynamic pages using child tables.
children.tooltipText: Create multi-level dynamic pages using child tables. Default value: false.

children.label: Foreign table ID
children.subtitle: ID of another table.
children.tooltipText: ID of another table to which the column refers/points to.

children.label: Foreign column ID
children.subtitle: ID of the column from another table.
children.tooltipText: ID of the column from another table to which the column refers/points to.

children.label: Dynamic meta tags
children.subtitle: Key value pairs.
children.tooltipText: The key value pairs of the metadata fields with the associated column ids. type: array

children.label: ID property
children.tooltipText: The name of a property with unique user values. Valid values are USER_ID(default) or EMAIL.
children.subtitle: Name of a property with unique user values.

children.label: User ID
children.tooltipText: Identifier of user to delete.
children.subtitle: Identifier of user to delete.

children.label: Object type
children.subtitle: Valid object type for the CRM.
children.tooltipText: Valid object type for the CRM (contacts, companies, deals, tickets, etc.)

children.label: Value
children.subtitle: Filter the matching property values
children.tooltipText: Use filters in the request body to limit the results to only records with matching property values.

children.label: Property name
children.subtitle: Filter the matching property values
children.tooltipText: Use filters in the request body to limit the results to only records with matching property values.

children.label: Operator
children.subtitle: Logical operator.
children.tooltipText: Logical operator. EQ (Equal to), LT (Less than), GT (Greater than),BETWEEN (Within the specified range), IN (Included within the specified list), CONTAINS_TOKEN.

children.label: Sorts
children.subtitle: Array with different sorting rules.
children.tooltipText: Use a sorting rule in the request body to list results in ascending or descending order. Only one sorting rule can be applied to any search.

children.label: Query
children.subtitle: Letter or word to find for all objects with a default text property that contain this value
children.tooltipText: Searches for all objects with a default text property value containing in the string.

children.label: Properties
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of the properties to be returned.
children.tooltipText: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the  response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. type: array

children.label: Limit
children.subtitle: Maximum number of results objects to display per page.
children.tooltipText: The maximum number of results to display per page.

children.label: After
children.subtitle: To obtain the token look for the next page token or after field, in the response.
children.tooltipText: The token returned in the cursor field of the response.
Properties to set on returned folder. type: array
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response.
children.label: Properties

children.tooltipText: Identifier of desired folder.
children.subtitle: Folder ID.
children.label: Folder ID
Object type
children.subtitle: Valid object type for the CRM.
children.tooltipText: Valid object type for the CRM (contacts, companies, deals, tickets, etc.)

children.label: Properties
children.subtitle: Properties object for the specific objectType.
children.tooltipText: A properties object for the specific objecType.

children.label: Properties
children.tooltipText: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the  response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the  requested object(s), they will be ignored. type: String[]
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response.

children.label: Properties with history
children.tooltipText: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with  their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are  not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of  this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be  read by a single request. type: String[]
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with  their history of previous values.

children.label: Associations
children.tooltipText: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs  for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be  ignored. type: String[]
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for.

children.label: Archived
children.tooltipText: Specifies whether to return archived objects.
children.subtitle: If true, return only archived results.

children.label: Object type
children.tooltipText: Valid object type for the CRM (contacts, companies, deals, tickets, etc.)
children.subtitle: Valid object type for the CRM.

children.label: Object ID
children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the object was created. If you do not remember it, you can use list objects to find the id.
children.subtitle: ID of the object.

children.label: Table ID or name
children.subtitle: ID or name of the table.
children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the table was created. If you do not remember it, you can use get published table to find the table ID or the name.

children.label: Row ID
children.subtitle: Row ID.
children.tooltipText: The ID of the row.

children.label: Email
children.tooltipText: The created user's email.
children.subtitle: User email.

children.label: Role ID
children.tooltipText: The user's role.
children.subtitle: User role ID.

children.label: Primary team ID
children.tooltipText: The user's primary team.
children.subtitle: User primary team ID.

children.label: Secondary team Ids
children.tooltipText: The user's additional teams.  type: array.
children.subtitle: User additional teams IDs.

children.label: Send welcome email
children.tooltipText: Whether to send a welcome email
children.subtitle: If true, send a welcome email.

children.tooltipText: PUBLIC_INDEXABLE:  File is publicly accessible by anyone who has the URL. Search engines  can index the file. PUBLIC_NOT_INDEXABLE: File is publicly accessible by anyone who has the URL. Search engines can't index the file. PRIVATE: File is NOT publicly accessible. Requires a signed URL to see content. Search engines can't  index the file.
children.subtitle: Type of access to the file.
children.label: Access

children.tooltipText: Time to live. If specified the file will be deleted after the given time frame.
children.subtitle: The file will be deleted after the given time frame.
children.label: TTL
Name
children.subtitle: Name of the resulting file in the file manager.
children.tooltipText: Name to give the resulting file in the file manager.
URL to download the new file from.
children.subtitle: URL to download the new file from.
children.label: URL
Folder path
children.subtitle: Destination folder path for the uploaded file.
children.tooltipText: One of folderPath or folderId is required. Destination folder path for the uploaded file. If the folder path does not exist, there will be an attempt to create the folder path.

children.label: Duplicate validation strategy
children.subtitle: Type of strategy for duplicate validation.
children.tooltipText: NONE: Do not run any duplicate validation. REJECT: Reject the upload if a duplicate is found. RETURN_EXISTING: If a duplicate file is found, do not upload a new file and return the found duplicate instead.

children.label: Duplicate validation scope
children.subtitle: Look for a duplicate file in the entire account or a duplicate file in the provided folder.
children.tooltipText: ENTIRE_PORTAL: Look for a duplicate file in the entire account. EXACT_FOLDER: Look for a duplicate file in the provided folder.

children.label: Overwrite
children.subtitle: If true, overwrites existing files if a file with the same name exists in the given folder.
children.tooltipText: If true, it will overwrite existing files if a file with the same name exists in the given folder.

children.label: Created at
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects created on exactly this date.
children.subtitle: Return redirects created on exactly this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ

children.label: Created after
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects created after this date.
children.subtitle: Return domains created after this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.

children.label: Created before
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects created before this date.
children.subtitle: Return domains created before this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.

children.label: Updated at
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects last updated on exactly this date.
children.subtitle: Return domains updated at this date. Format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.

children.label: Updated after
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects last updated after this date.
children.subtitle: Return domains updated after this date.  Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.

children.label: Updated before
children.tooltipText: Only return redirects last updated before this date.
children.subtitle: Return domains updated before this date.  Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.

children.label: Sort
children.tooltipText: Column names to sort the results by. type: array.
children.subtitle: Column names to sort the results by.

children.label: Properties
children.tooltipText: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. type: array.
children.subtitle: Comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response.

children.label: Next page token
children.tooltipText: The token returned in the cursor field of the response.
children.subtitle: To obtain the token look for the next page token or after field, in the response.

children.label: Before page token
children.tooltipText: The token returned in the cursor field of the response.
children.subtitle: To obtain the token look for the next page token or  before field, in the response.

children.label: Limit
children.tooltipText: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 1000.
children.subtitle: The maximum number of published tables to return.

children.label: Archived
children.tooltipText: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to false.
children.subtitle: Whether to return only archived results.

children.label: URL redirect ID
children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the URL redirect was created. If you do not remember it, you can use get current redirects to find the id.
children.subtitle: Write the ID of the target redirect.

children.label: Name
children.tooltipText: Desired name for the folder.
children.subtitle: Folder name.

children.label: Parent path
children.subtitle: Path of the parent of the created folder. If not specified the folder will be created at the root level.
children.tooltipText: Path of the parent of the created folder. If not specified the folder will be created at the root level. parentFolderPath and parentFolderId cannot be set at the same time.
The ID of the target redirect.
children.subtitle: The ID of the target redirect.
children.label: URL redirect ID

children.tooltipText: Identifier that was used when the URL redirect was created. If you do not remember it, you can use get current redirects to find the id.
children.subtitle: Unique ID of this URL redirect.
children.label: ID

children.tooltipText: The target incoming URL, path, or pattern to match for redirection.
children.subtitle: Target incoming URL
children.label: Route prefix
Destination
children.subtitle: Destination URL
children.tooltipText: The destination URL, where the target URL should be redirected if it matches the routePrefix.

children.label: Redirect style
children.subtitle: Type of redirect to create.
children.tooltipText: The type of redirect to create. Options include: 301 (permanent), 302 (temporary), or 305 (proxy).

children.label: Is only after not found
children.subtitle: If true the URL redirect mapping should apply.
children.tooltipText: Whether the URL redirect mapping should apply only if a live page on the URL isn't found. If False, the URL redirect mapping will take precedence over any existing page.

children.label: Is match full URL
children.subtitle: If  true the routePrefix  should match on the entire URL.
children.tooltipText: Whether the routePrefix  should match on the entire URL, including the domain.

children.label: Is match query string
children.subtitle: If true the routePrefix should match the entire URL route.
children.tooltipText: Whether the routePrefix  should match on the entire URL path, including the query string.

children.label: Is pattern
children.subtitle: If true the routePrefix  should match based on pattern.
children.tooltipText: Whether the routePrefix  should match based on pattern.

children.label: Is trailing slash optional
children.subtitle: If true a trailing slash will be ignored.
children.tooltipText: Whether a trailing slash will be ignored.

children.label: Is protocol agnostic
children.subtitle: if true, the routePrefix  should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols
children.tooltipText: Whether the routePrefix  should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

children.label: Precedence
children.subtitle: Prioritize URL redirection.
children.tooltipText: Used to prioritize URL redirection. If a given URL matches more than one redirect, the one with the lower precedence will be used.

children.label: Created at
children.subtitle: URL redirect was first created.
children.tooltipText: When the url redirect was first created, in milliseconds since the epoch.

children.label: Updated at
children.subtitle: URL redirect was last updated.
children.tooltipText: When the url redirect was last updated, in milliseconds since the epoch.

The incoming URL, path, or pattern to match. If you do not remember how its looks, you can use get current redirects to find routePrefix examples.
children.subtitle: Incoming URL, path or pattern to match.
children.label: Route prefix

children.tooltipText: The destination URL, where the target URL should be redirected if it matches the routePrefix. If you do not remember how its looks, you can use get current redirects to find destination examples.
children.subtitle: Destination URL
children.label: Destination

children.tooltipText: The type of redirect to create. Options include: 301 (permanent), 302 (temporary), or 305 (proxy).
children.subtitle: Type of redirect to create.
children.label: Redirect style

children.tooltipText: Used to prioritize URL redirection. If a given URL matches more than one redirect, the one with the lower precedence will be used.
children.subtitle: Prioritize URL redirection.
children.label: Precedence

children.tooltipText: Whether the URL redirect mapping should apply only if a live page on the URL isn't found. If False, the URL redirect mapping will take precedence over any existing page.
children.subtitle: If true, URL redirect mapping should apply only if a live page on the URL isn't found.
children.label: Is only after not found

children.tooltipText: If true, the 'routePrefix' should match on the entire URL including the domain.
children.subtitle: If true, the 'routePrefix' should match on the entire URL including the domain.
children.label: Is match full URL

children.tooltipText: If true, the 'routePrefix' should match on the entire URL path including the query string.
children.subtitle: If true 'routePrefix' should match on the entire URL path.
children.label: Is match query string

children.tooltipText: Set to true if you are creating a flexible pattern based URL mapping.
children.subtitle: If true, create a flexible pattern based URL mapping.
children.label: Is pattern

children.tooltipText: Whether a trailing slash will be ignored.
children.subtitle: If true, a trailing slash will be ignored.
children.label: Is trailing slash optional

children.tooltipText: Whether the routePrefix  should match both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.
children.subtitle: If true,  the routePrefixmatch both HTTP and HTTPS protocols.
children.label: Is protocol agnostic

children.label: Next page token
children.subtitle: To obtain the token look for the next page token or after field, in the response.
children.tooltipText: The token returned in the cursor field of the response.

children.label: Limit
children.subtitle: The maximum number of published tables to return.
children.tooltipText: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 1000.

children.label: Created at
children.subtitle: Return domains created at this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables created at exactly the specified time.

children.label: Created after
children.subtitle: Return domains created after this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables created after the specified time.

children.label: Created before
children.subtitle: Return domains created before this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables created before the specified time.

children.label: Updated at
children.subtitle: Return domains updated at this date. Format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables last updated at exactly the specified time.

children.label: Updated after
children.subtitle: Return domains updated after this date.  Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables last updated after the specified time.

children.label: Updated before
children.subtitle: Return domains updated before this date.  Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sZ.
children.tooltipText: Only return tables last updated before the specified time.

children.label: Archive
children.subtitle: Whether to return only archived results.
children.tooltipText: Specifies whether to return archived tables. Defaults to false.

children.tooltipText: The message text. Can be up to 1,600 characters long.

children.label: Body
Send at
children.subtitle: Define the time that Twilio will send the message. Must be in UTC format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
children.tooltipText: The time that Twilio will send the message. Must be in UTC format.
Read messages sent to only this phone number.
children.subtitle: Destination phone number
children.label: To

children.tooltipText: Read messages sent from only this phone number or alphanumeric sender ID.
children.subtitle: Read messages sent from only this phone number.
children.label: From

children.tooltipText: The date of the messages to show. Specify a date as YYYY-MM-DD in GMT to read only messages sent on this date. For example: 2009-07-06.
children.subtitle: Define the date of the messages to show
children.label: DateSent

children.tooltipText: Number of records to pull.
children.subtitle: Write the number of records to pull

children.tooltipText: A Twilio phone number in E.164 format, an alphanumeric sender ID, or a channel Endpoint address that is enabled for the type of message you want to send. Phone numbers or short codes purchased from Twilio also work here. You cannot, for example, spoof messages from a private cell phone number. If you are using messaging_service_sid, this parameter must be empty.

children.tooltipText: ID of Airtable base. type: Strng
children.subtitle: Airtable ID. Example: appXXXXXXXXX

children.subtitle: Table name. Example: Projects

children.label: Record ID
children.tooltipText: ID of record to be deleted. type: String
children.subtitle: Record ID. Example: recXXXXXXXXXX

children.tooltipText: ID of the Airtable base. type: String
children.subtitle: Airtable ID. Example: appXXXXXXXXX
children.label: Base ID

children.tooltipText: Name of table in Airtable base. type: String
children.subtitle: Table name. Example: Projects
children.label: Table name

children.tooltipText: Enter records for creation. type: array
children.subtitle: Records to add in the table. Example: [{ "fields": { "name": "Test" }}]
children.label: Records

children.tooltipText: ID of Airtable base. type: String
children.subtitle: Airtable ID. Example: appXXXXXXXXX
children.label: Base ID

children.tooltipText: Name of table in Airtable base. type: String
children.subtitle: Table name. Example: Projects
children.label: Table name

children.tooltipText: Only data for fields whose names are in this list will be included in the result. If you don't need every field, you can use this parameter to reduce the amount of data transferred. type: array
children.subtitle: Only data for fields whose names are in this list will be included in the result.
children.label: Fields

children.tooltipText: A formula used to filter records. The formula will be evaluated for each record, and if the result is not 0,                   false,"",NaN,[], or #Error!the record will be included in the response. type: String
children.subtitle: A formula used to filter records.
children.label: Filter by formula

children.tooltipText: The maximum total number of records that will be returned in your requests. If this value is larger than pageSize(which is 100 by default), you may have to load multiple pages to reach this total. type: integer
children.subtitle: Maximum number of records to return. Example: 100
children.label: Max records

children.tooltipText: The number of records returned in each request. Must be less than or equal to 100. Default is 100. See the Pagination section below for more. type: Number
children.subtitle: Maximum number of results to return. Example: 100
children.label: Page size

children.tooltipText: A list of sort objects that specifies how the records will be ordered. Each sort object must have a field               key specifying the name of the field to sort on, and an optional directionkey that is either "asc" or "desc". The default direction is "asc". type: array
children.subtitle: Columns names to sort the result by.
children.label: Sort

children.tooltipText: The name or ID of a view in the tableName. If set, only the records in that view will be returned. type: String
children.subtitle: The name or ID of a view in the tableName. Example: GridView
children.label: View

children.tooltipText: The format that should be used for cell values. Supported values are: json and string. The default is json. type: String
children.subtitle: Format to used for cell values. Example: json
children.label: Cell format

children.tooltipText: The time zone that should be used to format dates when using string as the cellFormat. This parameter is required when using string as the cellFormat. type: String
children.subtitle: time zone that should be used to format dates when using string as the cellFormat
children.label: Time zone

children.tooltipText: The user locale that should be used to format dates when using string as the cellFormat. This parameter is required when using string as the cellFormat. type: String
children.subtitle: user locale that should be used to format dates when using string as the cellFormat.
children.label: User locale

children.tooltipText: If there are more records, the response will contain an offset.To fetch the next page of records, include offset in the next request's parameters. Pagination will stop when you've reached the end of your table. If the maxRecords parameter is passed, pagination will stop once you've reached this maximum. type: String
children.subtitle: Paging cursor token to get the next set of results. Example: itrZ5o03g2WP95ntX/recvKqNLuVajJw9MY.
children.label: Offset

children.tooltipText: ID of Airtable base. type: String
children.subtitle: Airtable ID. Example: appXXXXXXXXX

children.label: Table name

children.subtitle: Table name. Example: Projects
